title: Innovating Elementary Language Studio Education through Design-Activism

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Strengthening students' creative problem-solving and social engagement capabilities through design-activism-based language learning activities in a smartphone-centric limited-technology environment.

learning_goals: Students perform activities to identify everyday language problems using smartphone apps and reinterpret them from a societal perspective.

Learners can collaborate in small teams (3â€“4 members) applying the three stages of the design-activism framework (problem definition, message development, visual implementation) to complete a language-related public message design project (digital/physical outputs) within five days and achieve an "Excellent" grade in four or more of five peer evaluation rubric items.
Participants improve their ability to analyze the social impact of language expressions through at least five formative assessments (quizzes/feedback).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
